snippet: Along the coast, communities have largely bounced back from the recession, but inland areas are still struggling with high unemployment and a persistent housing crisis.
abstract: Communities along California's coastline have largely bounced back from the economic recession, even as inland areas continue to struggle with high unemployment and a persistent housing crisis; plight of California's interior communities has reversed a decades-long trend of middle-class workers moving in from the coast to gobble up affordable housing.
lead_paragraph: Along the coast, communities have largely bounced back from the recession, but inland areas are still struggling with high unemployment and a persistent housing crisis.

headline.seo: California’s Economic Split Pits West Against East
headline.main: In California, Economic Gap of East vs. West
headline.print_headline: In California, Economic Gap Of East vs. West
